shared_text:
Big Spring School District
April 17 at 1:16 PM ·

The Big Spring School District is launching a ThoughtExchange survey to engage the Big Spring Community in dialogue around creative and meaningful methods to honor the Class of 2020, should a traditional graduation ceremony be deemed unsafe. This survey tool enables participants to submit as many ideas as they’d like, assign a rating to each idea, and to monitor trends as they develop. Ultimately, this exchange will provide for the most valued alternatives for the Big Spring School District to consider when making arrangements to celebrate our graduates.
The exchange will go live on Monday, April 20th and will conclude on Monday, April 27th. To access the ThoughtExchange survey and information page, please go to the district website at www.bigspringsd.org and click the news story titled “2020 Graduation Ideas – Share Your Voice!” During this survey window, please engage with the tool often as an idea contributor and a rater of ideas as well. Thank you in advance, for being creative, collaborative, and to critically thinking through key solutions to this novel situation!
#BSSDProud

BSSD had a special visitor this week. Senator Judy Ward came by on Tuesday, January 21st to see what the students here at Big Spring are learning within their classrooms. She was able to tour some of the classrooms at Oak Flat Elementary School, as well as some at Big Spring High School. The students were excited about having Senator Ward visit their class and even enjoyed explaining to her what they are currently working on!

Below is what Senator Ward had to say about her visit at Big Spring School District, as well as some photos from her visit.

"I was very impressed with my recent visit to Big Spring School District. I enjoyed learning about the innovative classroom design for the students. Flexible seating and flexible academic work schedules were just some of the areas I learned are provided to facilitate student learning. There are great things happening at Big Spring School District and I am proud to have the administration, faculty and students in my legislative district."

Thanks again for stopping by to see all the wonderful things happening at BSSD! #BSSDProud

shared_text:
Big Spring School District
December 6, 2019 at 3:02 PM ·

This year, NHS will be hosting their annual Food Drive and their very first Coat Drive. In order to make sure this event is a success and so that we can support as many local families as possible, we are asking the help of the entire district to collect materials for each drive. During the week of December 9th through the 13th, there will be food collection boxes in each of our Elementary schools as well as the High School for students to bring in food donation items. Located in every school within the district will be a box for the Coat Drive. Donations for the coat drive can include gently used winter garments such as coats, gloves, hats, and scarves of all sizes. These collection boxes will be placed in the office, cafeteria, or common area of each school throughout the entire week. Thank you all for your support with this event and for helping to provide for families in our community. Have a wonderful holiday season!

In order to make sure this event is a success and so that we can support as many local families as possible, we are asking the help of the entire district to collect materials for each drive. During the week of December 9th through the 13th, there will be food collection boxes in each of our Elementary schools as well as the High School for students to bring in food donation items. Located in every school within the district will be a box for the Coat Drive. Donations for the coat drive can include gently used winter garments such as coats, gloves, hats, and scarves of all sizes. These collection boxes will be placed in the office, cafeteria, or common area of each school throughout the entire week.
